text: Cross Purposes Live is a boxed set released by the British heavy metal band Black Sabbath in 4 April 1995. The set comprised a live album on CD and a VHS tape of a concert recorded at the Hammersmith Apollo in London on Wednesday 13 April 1994, recorded on the band's tour for their Cross Purposes album. The tour was notable for being the first time The Wizard had been played since early 1971, when Ozzy Osbourne was still lead vocalist.https://www.setlist.fm/stats/black-sabbath-33d6806d.html It is Black Sabbath's only live album with singer Tony Martin. The CD was housed within an oversized videotape case but had its own inserts and jewel case.https://www.amazon.com/Cross-Purposes-Live-Black-Sabbath/dp/B00073QG7G Both the original CD and VHS tape are out of print, but an hour long unlicensed DVD was released with nine of the sixteen original video tracks. This release includes the promo videoclip of "Feels Good to Me", from 1990's Tyr. ==Track listings== ==Credits== *Tony Iommi – guitar *Geezer Butler – bass guitar *Geoff Nicholls – keyboards *Tony Martin – vocals *Bobby Rondinelli – drums ==See also== ==References== Category:Black Sabbath live albums Category:1995 live albums Category:Live video albums Category:1995 video albums Category:Black Sabbath video albums Category:I.R.S. Records live albums Category:Albums recorded at the Hammersmith Apollo
title: Cross Purposes Live
